sources.title: The Big Clock (1948) Ray Milland, Charles Laughton, Maureen O' Sullivan
sources.description: The Big Clock is a 1948 American film noir directed by John Farrow and adapted by novelist-screenwriter Jonathan Latimer from the 1946 novel of the same name by Kenneth Fearing.   The black-and-white film is set in New York City and stars Ray Milland, Charles Laughton, and Maureen O'Sullivan. Elsa Lanchester and Harry Morgan, in an early film role, also appear.   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia and read an article from FILM NOlR of the Week .

sources.title: EL RELOJ ASESINO – (1948)
sources.description: The Big Clock Año: 1948 Duración: 95 min. País DE ORIGEN: Estados Unidos Estados Unidos Dirección: John Farrow Guion: Jonathan Latimer. Novela: Kenneth Fearing Reparto: Ray Milland , Maureen O'Sullivan , Charles Laughton y Elsa Lanchester Fotografía: Daniel L. Fapp, John F. Seitz (B&W) Música: Victor Young Género: Film Noir, Cine negro, Crimen, Periodismo, Sinopsis El poderoso editor de un importante periódico comete un crimen pasional. Para evitar que lo descubran incrimina a un tipo al que no conoce, pero que casualmente resulta estar ligado al diario. El "falso culpable" utilizará entonces todos los medios a su alcance para probar su inocencia. ( FILMAFFINITY )

metadata.Plot: When powerful publishing tycoon Earl Janoth commits an act of murder at the height of passion, he cleverly begins to cover his tracks and frame an innocent man whose identity he doesn't know but who just happens to have contact with the murder victim. That man is a close associate on his magazine whom he enlists to trap this "killer" - George Stroud. It's up to George to continue to "help" Janoth, to elude the police and to find proof of his innocence and Janoth's guilt.
metadata.Writer: Jonathan Latimer, Kenneth Fearing, Harold Goldman
metadata.Actors: Ray Milland, Maureen O'Sullivan, Charles Laughton
